body.section: Hierarchy BloodPressureObservation is a kind of VitalSignObservationEvent

section.title: Description
section.p: The value of the Vital Sign Observation expressed as a collection of other Vital Sign Observations. For example, Blood Pressure is expressed as a Diastolic and a Systolic measurement.

stentry.p: A measurement is recorded by two numbers. The first (systolic pressure) is measured after the heart contracts and is highest. &lt;HTML&gt;&lt;HEAD&gt; &lt;META content="MSHTML 6.00.2900.3429" name=GENERATOR&gt;&lt;/HEAD&gt; &lt;BODY&gt; &lt;TABLE style="WIDTH: 443pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width=590 border=0 x:str&gt; &lt;COLGROUP&gt; &lt;COL style="WIDTH: 443pt; mso-width-source: userset; mso-width-alt: 21577" width=590&gt; &lt;TBODY&gt; &lt;TR style="HEIGHT: 28.5pt; mso-height-source: userset" height=38&gt; &lt;TD class=xl24 style="BORDER-RIGHT: #ece9d8; BORDER-TOP: #ece9d8; BORDER-LEFT: #ece9d8; WIDTH: 443pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #ece9d8; HEIGHT: 28.5pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent" width=590 height=38&gt;&lt;FONT face=Arial size=2&gt;Diastolic blood pressure refers to the pressure of blood in the artery when the heart relaxes between beats. It is the bottom (and lower) number in a blood pressure reading.&lt;/FONT&gt;&lt;BR&gt;&lt;BR&gt;&lt;BR&gt;&lt;/TD&gt;&lt;/TR&gt;&lt;/TBODY&gt;&lt;/TABLE&gt;&lt;/BODY&gt;&lt;/HTML&gt;

The second (diastolic pressure) is measured before the heart contracts and lowest. &lt;HTML&gt;&lt;HEAD&gt; &lt;META content="MSHTML 6.00.2900.3429" name=GENERATOR&gt;&lt;/HEAD&gt; &lt;BODY&gt; &lt;TABLE style="WIDTH: 443pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse" cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width=590 border=0 x:str&gt; &lt;COLGROUP&gt; &lt;COL style="WIDTH: 443pt; mso-width-source: userset; mso-width-alt: 21577" width=590&gt; &lt;TBODY&gt; &lt;TR style="HEIGHT: 51pt" height=68&gt; &lt;TD class=xl24 style="BORDER-RIGHT: #ece9d8; BORDER-TOP: #ece9d8; BORDER-LEFT: #ece9d8; WIDTH: 443pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #ece9d8; HEIGHT: 51pt; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent" width=590 height=68&gt;&lt;FONT face=Arial size=2&gt;Systolic blood pressure refers to the pressure of blood in the artery when the heart contracts. It is the top (and higher) number in a blood pressure reading.&lt;/FONT&gt;&lt;BR&gt;&lt;BR&gt;&lt;/TD&gt;&lt;/TR&gt;&lt;/TBODY&gt;&lt;/TABLE&gt;&lt;/BODY&gt;&lt;/HTML&gt;
